result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J Weber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 14CF424 & 14CM440 called together at 10:12 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Nicholas J Weber in court with Attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

On Ct#1-14CM440 & Cts #1, #2 & #3, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 6 months, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No presence in bars or taverns 
--Random testing for illegal drug use
--To pay costs of $972 ($243 each count)
--To pay $800 DNA Surcharge ($200 each count)
--To pay a fine of $500 + costs = $883 (14CF424-Ct#1)
--60 hours of community service work for a public agency or a non-profit charitable organization pursuant to 973.09(7m)(a) - (14CM440)

Days credit for time already served: 1 days - 14CM440
Days credit for time already served: 0 days - 14CF424
Recess: 10:29 am
Supplemental sentencing memorandum submitted by Attorney Rothstein
Sentencing hearing on January 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Criminal complaint amended by Judge O'Briens own hand
Proposed amendment to count 1 in the criminal complaint

Cases 14CF424 & 14CM440 called together at 10:42 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Nicholas J Weber in court with Attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Rothstein submits plea paperwork & Proposed Amendment to Ct#1 in criminal complaint

14CF424: Service of the Complaint admitted along with AMENDMENT TO CT#1 IN COMPLAINT; reading waived
Court reviews criminal case settlement form with parties

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Ct#1-14CM440 & Cts #1 (as amended), Ct#2 & Ct#3-14CF424; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count#2-14CM440 
Court notes that It will not address TR matters noted on criminal case settlement
Recess: 10:51 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Sentencing Hearing 1/20/15 at 10:00 am - Send notices
